Package eg.document

Class EditableDocument

java.lang.Object
eg.document.EditableDocument
public final class EditableDocument
extends java.lang.Object
Represents the document that is edited

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors 
    Constructor Description
    EditableDocument​(EditArea editArea)
    Creates a blank EditableDocument
    EditableDocument​(EditArea editArea, Languages lang)
    Creates a blank EditableDocument with the specified language
    EditableDocument​(EditArea editArea, java.io.File f)
    Creates an EditableDocument with the specified file

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    void changeLanguage​(Languages lang)

    Displays the content of the specified file but does not set the file

    Marks the beginning or the end of a merged undoable unit.

      Returns:
      the boolen value that is true if the text content could be saved

    • setFile

      public boolean setFile​(java.io.File f)
      Sets the specified file and saves the text content to the file. A previously set file is replaced.
      Parameters:
      f - the file
      Returns:
      true if the text content could be saved, false otherwise

      public void displayFileContentIgnoreLang​(java.io.File f)
      Diplays the content of the specified file but does not set the file and also does not set the language that would correspond to the file type

      f - the file

      public void enableUndoMerging​(boolean b)
      Marks the beginning or the end of a merged undoable unit. Calls TypingEdit.disableBreakpointAdding(boolean)
      Parameters:
      b - true to begin meging, false to end merging

    • remove

      public void remove​(int pos, int length, boolean highlight)
      Removes a section from the document
      Parameters:
      pos - the position where the section starts
      length - the length of the section
      highlight - true to update syntax highlighting after the removal, false otherwise. Is ignored if the language is normal text

    • replace

      public void replace​(int pos, int length, java.lang.String s)
      Replaces a section with the specified string
      Parameters:
      pos - the position where the section to be replaced starts
      length - the length of the section
      s - the string
